text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with strawberry syrup that's right
we're going to take fresh strawberries
and make our own homemade fruit syrup
which then we're going to turn into the
world's best most amazing strawberry
soda so hopefully you have access to
super amazing sweet strawberries right
now and if you do this is so easy you're
gonna have to try it okay so step one
we're going to take two pounds of really
ripe strawberries the sweetest best
strawberries you can find we're going to
hold them which simply means take out
the green part and then we're just going
to cut them up and of course you could
take a paring knife and just cut these
straight across the top but then you
lose a lot of the strawberry so I want
you to take the tip of the knife and
just go around like that and then you're
just basically removing the green part
leaving the delicious sweet flesh intact
and if they're normal-sized berries you
can just quarter them if they're medium
sized maybe cut them in six if they're
huge cut them in eighths well if they're
in between medium and huge I would go at
seventh and by the way I'm cutting these
into a heavy-bottomed saucepan and once
those are all cut we're going to pour in
some fresh cold water we're going to
bring that over to the stove and we're
gonna put that on high heat and bring it
to a boil now there's absolutely no
reason to stir at this point unless
you're trying to show off your
freakishly small wooden spoon which I
always like to do alright when that
comes to a boil give it a stir it's for
real this time
back the heat down to low maybe just a

nice gentle simmer for 15 minutes 15
minutes later it's going to look
something like this warning the
strawberries get incredibly ugly but
that's okay we want them to release all
their deliciousness all their sweet
amazing strawberry nacinda that liquid
and the color is going to go along with
it so that's fine so our Heat's off I'm
going to take another saucepan put a
strainer in it a fine strainer and I'm
going to ladle that mixture in and we're
going to discard the strawberry pulp now
if you want extra juice you can push
that stuff through but you're going to
get a very cloudy strawberry syrup it
looks a lot nicer if it's clear so
usually we don't do that but it's up to
you so let it drain really really well
and when it's all dripped out we're
going to add our sugar so I'm going a

little stir
I'm gonna put the heat back on high and
bring this to a boil again all right
once it comes up to a boil I'm gonna put
the heat down to medium and we're going
to cook that exactly 5 minutes that's
going to be plenty of time to dissolve
the sugar and it will also give us a
chance to skim some of the foam from the

that's right when it's cooled your
strawberry syrup is done we're going to
